title: Find Peak Element
description:
A peak element is an element that is strictly greater than its neighbors.

Given an integer array nums, find a peak element and return its index. If the array contains multiple peaks, return the index of any one of them.

You may assume that:

  • nums[-1] = -∞
  • nums[n] = -∞

This means elements outside the array are always smaller.

Example 1:

Input: nums = [1,2,3,1]
Output: 2
Explanation: 3 is greater than both 2 and 1, so it is a peak.

Example 2:

Input: nums = [1,2,1,3,5,6,4]
Output: 5
Explanation: 6 is a peak element.

Constraints:

  • 1 <= nums.length <= 104
  • -231 <= nums[i] <= 231 - 1
  • nums[i] != nums[i + 1] for all valid i
